description: Dive into "Chamonix's Picture-Perfect Peaks" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Chamonix's Picture-Perfect Peaks

places.generalDescription: Aiguille du Midi is a 3,842-meter summit in the Mont Blanc massif, easily accessible year-round via cable car from Chamonix. The area offers a range of activities for all types of travelers, from visiting the highest gourmet restaurant in town to embarking on adventurous experiences like climbing Mont Blanc or taking a helicopter ride over glaciers.

sources.snippet: France‚Äôs Chamonix Valley is one of the most scenic places on the European continent. It‚Äôs a narrow river valley which houses everything from rock-climbing centers to pulsing bars and pubs, and on both sides of the river the peaks of the French Alps explode thousands of feet into the sky. While there are numerous ways to experience the grandeur of the mountains from Chamonix‚Äîboarding the ski lift at Les Grands Montets, biking along the steep ridges, or paragliding off the many peaks‚Äîthe most accessible might be a ride on the Aiguille du Midi cable car, a hair-raising ascent that gains 9,200 vertical feet over the course of 20 minutes.
sources.shortName: Best Things to Do in Chamonix

sources.snippet:
Chamonix's biggest draw is the
 highest peak in western Europe, the 4810 metre Mont Blanc
 (Monte Bianco in Italian, both names meaning the 'White
 Mountain'). Mont Blanc is, in fact, just one of seventeen 4000-metre
 peaks in the Mont Blanc Massif, a mountain range in the Graian
 Alps. The Massif's other famous summits include Mont Maudit (4465
 metres, meaning Cursed Mountain), the 4208 metre Grandes
 Jorasses (which boasts one of the six great north
 faces of the Alps), and the Aiguille Verte (4122 metres,
 meaning Green Needle).
sources.shortName: 10 best things to do in Chamonix

sources.snippet: Afterwards, the 20 minutes ride up the Aiguille du Midi went pretty smoothly. The Aiguille du Midi is a 3842 m rock formation at the Mont Blanc massif and hosts the cable car station, a restaurant and some board walks with stunning views towards the mountain. We stopped in Chamonix for two nights on our way to Southern France to visit the famous "white mountain".
sources.shortName: Mont Blanc near Chamonix

sources.snippet: Deux t√©l√©ph√©riques, un voyage de 20 minutes et vous voil√† √† 3‚ÄØ842 m√®tres. L‚Äô Aiguille du Midi, c‚Äôest LE lieux √† voir au moins une fois dans sa vie !. Point de d√©part de nombreuses courses d‚Äôalpinisme et de de la mythique Vall√©e Blanche, l‚ÄôAiguille du Midi offre une vue imprenable √† 360 degr√©s sur le Mont-Blanc et les Alpes fran√ßaises, suisses et italiennes.
sources.shortName: √Ä la d√©couverte des plus beaux sites de la vall√©e de Chamonix

sources.snippet: Next is the exhilarating Aiguille du Midi viewpoint that offers a complete panoramic view of the Alps, extending to the neighboring mountain peaks of Italy and Switzerland. The highest terrace is 3,842 meters high and directly views the famous Mont Blanc. This is a must-see attraction for those who can withstand heights.
sources.shortName: Chamonix Is the French Alps at Their Finest ‚Äî Here‚Äôs How to Make the Most of It

sources.snippet: The second photo spot in the French Alps is again in Chamonix. The view of Aiguille du Midi mountain is simply breathtaking, but it can‚Äôt be compared to looking vertically down into the valley and the surrounding ice worlds from its summit.
sources.shortName: PHOTO SPOTS OF FRANCE: GREAT LOCATIONS FOR PHOTOGRAPHERS

sources.snippet: The Aiguille du Midi is a 3,842-metre-tall mountain in the Mont Blanc massif within the French Alps. It is a popular tourist destination and can be directly accessed by cable car from Chamonix that takes visitors close to Mont Blanc.
sources.shortName: Travel Guide of Chamonix by Influencers for 2023

sources.snippet: Year-round, cable cars take visitors up to several nearby peaks with panoramic views, including Aiguille du Midi above town, and Pointe Helbronner, across vast glacier fields on the Italian border.
sources.siteName: Photographer in Chamonix - Family and adventure photo sessions
sources.shortName: Adventure in Chamonix 2019 - 4 days - Photographer in Chamonix

places.name: Aiguille du Midi

reviews.text: Incredible view . The beauty is breathtaking. You can see the highest peak in Europe from afar. Many people paragliding here. It is a must-visit place in life.
Absolutely amazing, once in a life time. Unique weather at 8 am, 4 degrees Celsius. At this altitude you are slow when you walk on the terraces.

Amazing experience. They give you a paper to indicate you have a time to get off the mountain to avoid rushes. Even though it was for 1.5 hours as the recommended time, we spent close to 4 hours (with about 1.5 hours for queuing for the glass dome alone). This was an unforgettable experience and highly recommended.

places.generalDescription: The Compagnie du Mont Blanc operates an aerial cable car that takes visitors to the renowned Chamonix-Mont-Blanc ski area. Surrounded by towering peaks such as Mont Blanc at 4,810m and Aiguille du Midi at 3,842m, the area offers breathtaking views and diverse hiking opportunities. Visitors should be prepared for varying weather conditions due to the high altitude.

sources.snippet: There‚Äôs no better place to take all the glory of the Alps than on l‚ÄôAiguille du Midi. At nearly 3.9km (2.4mi) up, it gives you an unmatched 360-degree panorama of the mountains, and a cable car from the heart of Chamonix will get you there in only 20 minutes. Ride it all the way up before scaling Mont Blanc, or you can stop at Plan de l‚ÄôAiguille on the way to hike to picturesque Montenvers.
sources.shortName: The Top Things To See And Do In Chamonix, France

sources.snippet: From the top of the Aiguille du Midi, don‚Äôt miss out on the opportunity to journey across the Glacier du G√©ant, landing in Italy on the Pointe Helbronner. From June to September, the cable car carries you suspended above seracs and crevasses. You can add the ticket to your lift pass for less than 30‚Ç¨, and it‚Äôs well worth it to be transported into this world of ice for a non-stop 50 minute journey.
sources.shortName: Unmissable viewpoints for photography in Chamonix

places.name: T√©l√©ph√©rique Aiguille du Midi

reviews.text: Absolutely incredible experience!!!! Don't fear the price or the line - it is 100% worth it. We originally wanted to go just go up to the mid section, but the lady at the ticket office convinced us to go up to the summit saying it was a one in a lifetime experience. And she was absolutely correct. The view is gorgeous, breathtaking. It is better to go up earlier in the morning because there is considerably less people, which makes everything a bit easier - shorter lines for the Void and the elevator to the top, and less crowded viewpoints.

Absolutely amazing experience, the views are incredible. To experience this truly is on another level. Even in hot weather it gets cold at the top and there is snow and ice yet an hour before I was in 90 degree heat, very strange haha. It is not a quick visit though, so if you have to get back in time for your bus or coach then book your visit to the mountain and give yourself several hours because once you are up there you cannot just get back down, so allow plenty of time. This is a place that everyone should experience at least once üèîÔ∏è

Absolutely amazing experience. The high price was worth it. The views were incredibly stunning. It will be cold on the top no matter what the temperature is on the cable car base. There was plenty of snow on the top in August. Once in a lifetime experience.

places.address: 100 Pl. de l'Aiguille du Midi, 74400 Chamonix-Mont-Blanc, France

places.generalDescription: Pointe Helbronner is a must-visit alpine summit, standing at 11,358 feet and offering breathtaking valley views. Accessible by cable car in a popular ski area, it provides stunning vistas of mountain peaks and features a glass wall showcasing local gemstones. Visitors can enjoy quality coffee at a charming cafe while admiring the peaks. Despite potential cold temperatures at the observation deck, the various platforms offer spectacular views even on cloudy days.

sources.snippet: The Panoramic Mont-Blanc gondola ride takes you from Aiguille du Midi to Pointe Helbronner in Italy from May through September. This is only recommended for travelers comfortable in cable cars and at height. The 50-minute journey is thrilling, soaring past the mountains below and covering 3.1 miles from peak to peak.
sources.shortName: Chamonix Is the French Alps at Their Finest ‚Äî Here‚Äôs How to Make the Most of It

places.name: Pointe Helbronner

reviews.text:
MUST VISIT ONCE IN A LIFETIME!!!
Beautiful view one of the highest peak of Europe, and the highest of Italy and France!!! 11th Peak in the World!!! Beautiful Panorama and astounding atmosphere... For those who are scared, it's not a big deal... The only thing we felt as a group is lower oxygen intake but not much more... The shelters are so good organized you don't feel like you are outside on one of the 11th peak...
We wen to the restaurant downstairs and it isn't so overpriced Like you can take a Brioches with Cappuccino at 4 Euros!!!
Even in Milan You can't get an offer like that... We ate typical Salumi and cheese with hot chocolate... Great Great Experience!!!
So yeah you can also visit it in every season and in March they also open the way to the France, You can come with your ski and do ski alpinism or throw yourself with the Paragliding with any problem.
The price to reach the peak is only 45 euros per person...
Beautiful breathtaking view from terrace and good prices in inside restaurant...
Duuuude! It was amazing. The dizziness from 30% less oxygen  than 20 minutes ago, the view, the cold, the... did I mention THE VIEW!!?!? Worth every cent.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the breathtaking Chamonix Valley, Parc de Merlet is a captivating wildlife park that invites nature lovers to explore its stunning landscapes. Perched at an altitude of 1,500 meters, this enchanting reserve offers visitors the chance to encounter over 70 species of mountain wildlife, including chamois, marmots, and deer.

sources.snippet: For another family-friendly attraction, the Parc de Merlet provides a great day out. It takes less than 20 minutes by train from Chamonix train station. It sits at 1,500 meters and overlooks the breathtaking alpine scenery.
sources.shortName: Chamonix Is the French Alps at Their Finest ‚Äî Here‚Äôs How to Make the Most of It

places.name: Parc de Merlet

reviews.text:
The location is quite and wonderful place to visit with your family especially children , make sure before coming you reservation from their website and easy to pay on ticket window there and enjoy around 1:30 horse hiking there with beautiful views and many animals.

For the parking there are 3 main areas to park (P1 -P2-P3)

Really super day, but we are keen walkers and wildlife watchers. Daughter loved seeing the animals in their natural habitat. The only thing I would say is that it isn't very clear that the bus doesn't run on a weekend and it is a strenuous walk up to the park from Les Houches.

The 4th visit, 1st time with the Family and they loved it. We managed to see most of the animals. The walk from parking to the park is very steep and may be ling depending how crowded it is and if you have elders or children.

places.address: 2495 Chem. de Merlet, 74310 Les Houches, France

places.generalDescription: Le Br√©vent is an alpine summit standing at 8,284 feet, offering hiking routes accessible by a cable car that provides breathtaking vistas of Mont Blanc. Visitors can take the gondola lift up to Planpraz and then embark on a steep hike to the top of Le Br√©vent for stunning views of the surrounding glaciers. While weather conditions may impact visibility, reaching the summit offers an incredible perspective of Chamonix Valley and the Tour de Mont Blanc.

sources.snippet: Visitors can discover some of the most beautiful scenery of the French Alps by taking the gondola rides up to Le Br√©vent. First, hop on the gondola lift from the Chamonix village to the first stop in Plan Praz (at an elevation of 2,000 meters). From Plan Praz, well-groomed hiking trails lead to the tranquil Lac Cornu and the Grand Balcon Sud.
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions in Chamonix-Mont-Blanc | PlanetWare

sources.snippet: If you seek more breathtaking scenery, take the gondola ride to Le Brevent. The gondola leaves from the main Chamonix village to the first stop in Plan Praz. Take the next gondola ride from Plan Praz, the Telepherique de Brevent, to Le Brevent‚Äôs summit.
sources.shortName: Chamonix Is the French Alps at Their Finest ‚Äî Here‚Äôs How to Make the Most of It

sources.snippet: Depuis Chamonix, une t√©l√©cabine vous transporte jusqu‚Äô√† Planpraz √† 1 999 m√®tres. Puis un t√©l√©ph√©rique vous conduit jusqu‚Äôau sommet du Br√©vent. √ât√© comme hiver, le Br√©vent offre une vue splendide sur toute la chaine du Mont-Blanc.
sources.shortName: √Ä la d√©couverte des plus beaux sites de la vall√©e de Chamonix

places.name: Le Br√©vent

reviews.text: Le Br√©vent is a mountain located in the French Alps, near the town of Chamonix. It offers some of the best panoramic views of the Mont Blanc massif. Accessible by cable car, Le Br√©vent is a popular destination for hikers, skiers, and climbers. In summer, visitors can enjoy hiking trails with spectacular views, while in winter, it's a sought-after skiing area. The summit provides a breathtaking vantage point over the surrounding mountains and the Chamonix Valley.
Amazing views of Mont Blanc! Cable car was a bit pricey, but worth it for the experience.

Le Br√©vent is one of the most renowned and accessible spots to enjoy a panoramic view of the majestic Mont Blanc. This location offers a truly beautiful experience for visitors, combining convenience with stunning natural beauty.

For those arriving by car, parking is available at the paid ¬´Parking du Br√©vent¬ª, where an 8-hour stay costs EUR 10.- as of August 2024.
From there, your adventure begins with a cable car ride to Planpraz. I recommend continuing on to Le Br√©vent for the full experience. A one-way ticket to ¬´Le Br√©vent¬ª costs EUR 26.-.

Planpraz: The first stop, is a must-see. From here, you'll be treated to breathtaking views of Mont Blanc, the Aiguille du Midi, and other nearby summits. It's a perfect spot for photography or simply taking in the grandeur of the Alps.

From Planpraz, hop on the cable car to Le Br√©vent, where you'll be rewarded with one of the most spectacular panoramic views of Mont Blanc. The scenery from this vantage point is unparalleled, making it a highlight of any trip to the region.

If you have time, consider dining at the restaurant "Le Panoramic" at the top. The food is good, and the views from the restaurant are just as impressive. However, it's advisable to book in advance, as it's a popular spot.

For those who enjoy hiking, there's the option to descend on foot from Le Br√©vent to Planpraz. The hike takes around 1 hour and 15 minutes, offering more incredible views along the way. Once back at Planpraz, you have several options to return to Chamonix (Parking Le Br√©vent):

1. Take the cable car: back down for a quick and easy return.
2. Walk the short path back: which is a bit challenging and takes around 2 hours.
3. Opt for the longer walk, which takes about 3 hours but is less difficult than the shorter path.

Le Br√©vent is a destination that perfectly combines accessibility with awe-inspiring natural beauty. Whether you're there for a quick visit or a full day of exploration, the views and experiences offered here are truly unforgettable.

For the courageous and well-trained, there's also the option to do a round trip from Chamonix to Le Br√©vent entirely on foot. This challenging hike offers an immersive experience with the stunning Alpine scenery, but you should be prepared to spend at least 7 hours on the trail. It's a demanding journey, but the rewards of the breathtaking views along the way make it well worth the effort.

Enjoy üòéüßò‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüôè‚òÄÔ∏èüèîÔ∏è

places.generalDescription: Mont Blanc, a 4,807m snowy mountain, offers various climbing routes and refuges along with a cable car. In the heart of Chamonix-Mont-Blanc, there's a cozy apartment with a balcony providing stunning views of Mont Blanc and Aiguille du Midi. It is conveniently located in the city center near popular attractions like Skyway Monte Bianco and Montenvers-Mer de Glace train station.

sources.snippet: Straddling three countries, Mont Blanc is the crown jewel of the Chamonix region. It‚Äôs the highest mountain in the Alps and one of the most imposing on the continent. The courageous can tackle this mountain head on, but that doesn‚Äôt mean the cautious will miss out: a cable car takes you straight up to the summit.
sources.shortName: The Top Things To See And Do In Chamonix, France

sources.snippet: Mont-Blanc is the highest peak of the Alps and forms part of the French border with Italy. Soaring to an altitude of 4,810 meters, Mont Blanc is always covered in snow, explaining why it's called the "White Mountain.". Mont Blanc is known as "the Roof of Europe" because of its thrilling viewpoints of the Aiguilles Rouges mountain ranges and Chamonix Valley.
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions in Chamonix-Mont-Blanc | PlanetWare

sources.snippet: Nothing can prepare you for the exquisite views of MB on the balcony path between le Br√©vent and Refuge Bellachat. The summit of le Br√©vent is one of the most famous viewpoints for MB but in our opinion the views are better further south. The panorama from the terrace of Refuge Bellachat is also sublime and a break there is an unforgettable experience.
sources.shortName: Chamonix's Bucket List Viewpoints

sources.snippet: You can‚Äôt come to Chamonix and not see the world-famous Mont Blanc. Mont Blanc forms part of the border with Italy and is always covered in snow, which is why it is named the White Mountain. It is also known as the ‚ÄúRoof of Europe,‚Äù so you can find fantastic views everywhere.
sources.shortName: Chamonix Is the French Alps at Their Finest ‚Äî Here‚Äôs How to Make the Most of It

sources.snippet: Looking up the Mont Blanc from the Chamonix valley it seemed far away. And it is: Like almost three kilometers higher than the valley. Chamonix is about 1000 m high and the Mont Blanc, the highest mountain of the alps and the EU, is 4810 m above sea level.
sources.shortName: Mont Blanc near Chamonix

sources.snippet: The Aiguille du Midi is a 3,842-metre-tall mountain in the Mont Blanc massif within the French Alps. It is a popular tourist destination and can be directly accessed by cable car from Chamonix that takes visitors close to Mont Blanc.
sources.shortName: Travel Guide of Chamonix by Influencers for 2023

sources.snippet: It is the alpine plateau northwest of Mont Blanc and Chamonix. Follow our hiking decription, use the hiking map and get inspired by those beautiful photogrpahs from our pro photographers.
sources.shortName: Chamonix Hikers‚Äô Vivid Viewpoint Lac Blanc / Lacs de Ch√©serys! South Balcony‚Äôs Grand Panorama of Chamonix Valley
10 best things to do in Chamonix

places.name: Mont Blanc

reviews.text: The French Alps are absolutely stunning-towering peaks, charming villages, and unforgettable views. We took the cable car  to Mount Blanc, every moment feels magical. A perfect escape for both adventure and peace. in the first stop (fist level) there is a small restaurant where you can have some cheese cakes coffee and local beers üçª
Amazing experience in the mountains! The views were absolutely amazing. Everyone should definitely see this!
The ice cave is definitely worth a visit, The views are stunning, and the food is quite good and reasonably priced. If you plan to visit the ice cave, be sure to wear a jacket, as you may get wet.

places.generalDescription: The Mont Blanc massif, located in the Alps, is a stunning natural wonder that offers a wide range of activities for both novice and experienced alpine enthusiasts. The area boasts popular winter resorts and climbing routes, making it a haven for adventure seekers. With its breathtaking mountain scenery, including the iconic Mont Blanc, as well as the charming city of Annecy and the picturesque villages around Lake Geneva, the region is a magnet for visitors throughout the year.

sources.snippet: The Best 300 Photo Spots In The Alps And Europe Mountain Moments The steep rock faces of the mont blanc massif, photo: mark j. the lac de cheserys lake near brevent cable station, with a view of mont blanc mountain ‚Äì a classic landscape photography spot, photo: ludovic f. chamonix is ‚Äòthe‚Äô mountaineering location in the alps.
sources.shortName: The Best 300 Photo Spots In The Alps And Europe Mountain Moments

places.name: Mont Blanc massif

reviews.text:
The Mont Blanc Summit is a breathtaking destination that every nature lover and adventure enthusiast should experience at least once in their lifetime. Towering majestically over the Alps, Mont Blanc serves as a stunning backdrop for a wide variety of activities that cater to different skill levels, physical conditions, and time commitments.

Whether you're an experienced mountaineer or someone who simply enjoys the beauty of nature, Mont Blanc offers an array of sports and recreational opportunities that allow you to fully immerse yourself in its stunning landscapes.

Among the numerous scenic spots to admire Mont Blanc, the well-known locations include:

- Chamonix
- Planpraz, Le Br√©vent
- Combloux
- Passy Lake
- Col des Saisies
- Les 4 Lacs de Cheserys
- Col de Balme
- Refuge Elena

Each of these spots provides a unique perspective of Mont Blanc, making every visit a new experience. Whether you're seeking a physical challenge or simply want to soak in the beauty of the Alps, Mont Blanc is a destination that never disappoints. The variety of sports and the breathtaking views at each location make it a truly exceptional destination for adventurers and photographers alike.
Enjoy üôèüòé
Summit is breathtaking. Views are amazing. They have restaurant at the top and a high speed lift to take you to the top.
Amazing experience, worth a trip using the cable cars. Bit scary but fantastic views and its cold up there so wrap up warm.

places.generalDescription: Nestled at an altitude of 1233m, Cascade du Dard is a charming 20m high waterfall offering breathtaking views of the Aiguilles Rouges, the glacier des Bossons, and the majestic Mont-Blanc. Accessible from Chamonix, it's a short 45-minute hike through dense forests that provides a sense of wilderness just moments away from town. You can also reach it by parking near the Mont-Blanc tunnel for a quicker walk.

sources.snippet: Fall in love with the Cascade du Dard on a quick afternoon hike in Chamonix. This near-3mi (5km) moderate loop trail has an elevation gain of roughly 427m (1,400ft), but is well worth it for the waterfall views. Prepare for an uphill climb that, though well-travelled, can be a little challenging if there‚Äôs snow or rain afoot.
sources.shortName: The Top Things To See And Do In Chamonix, France

places.name: Cascade du Dard

reviews.text:
Great small hike that can easily be done with your kids and/ordogs! We started on the trail by the highway, so our loop was 4 km with 207m of incline. There is also a parking lot nearby to make it more convenient if you'd rather drive here!! Super accessible for people of all ages and abilities.

A few people were disappointed since they thought the waterfall would be taller or more majestic, but coming from the Canadian Rockies, I still thought this waterfall was just beautiful!! 10/10 would recommend seeing this beauty.
Beautiful,  worth the hike
Lovely hike, beautiful waterfall with a delightful cafe.

places.generalDescription: La Jonction is a magical place where the Bossons and Taconnaz Glaciers separate. The hike to La Jonction involves walking on a rocky outcrop with glaciers on each side, sometimes using ladders and cables. Despite the significant altitude drop, the ascent is quick, covering about 1200m to 1600m depending on the starting point. The trail leads to a stunning viewpoint offering panoramic views of Mont Blanc's frozen seracs.

sources.shortName: Best summer picnic spots in Chamonix

places.name: La jonction

reviews.text:
The most beautiful hike I've ever been on. Challenging, extremely steep, and with a backdrop straight out of a fantasy a la Lord of the Rings. The glaciers and Mountain vistas were simply spectacular!

Worth all the suffering, but not for the faint of heart! Not a hike for beginners!!
A difficult hike with some scrambling involved and steep slopes that can be slippery on a dry day - come prepared! Definitely worth a trip, the viewpoint is very close to the glaciers!

Arguably the best hike in Chamonix if you're fit enough to make it to the top. The rewards for your efforts are huge, the views from la Jonction are breathtaking.

You can cut around 300m elevation gain if you use the t√©l√©siege, it will leave you around 1400m to climb. The first half, to the Chalet des Pyramides is easy, gradient is steady and low and you can easily keep your pace. Some of the hikers finish here, you can have a modest lunch in the chalet, the view on the Bossons glacier is majestic.

The second half is tougher as the path becomes much steeper and in some places requires some basic climbing skills. But I've seen even 8-9 yo deal with it with no problem. The children were clearly already experienced hikers despite their age.

It took me just under 3 hours to climb to la Jonction from the t√©l√©siege arrival point.

places.generalDescription: The Br√©vent Cable Car in Chamonix offers a thrilling and breathtaking ascent to one of the highest viewpoints in the area, providing panoramic views of Mont Blanc and the Chamonix Valley. Visitors can enjoy the stunning scenery from the top, where there are options for picnicking, snacking, or dining at a restaurant. The cable car is recommended over Aiguille du Midi for its unrivaled panorama and smooth ride suitable for both kids and adults.

sources.snippet: If it‚Äôs more stunning mountain views you want, make your next stop the Br√©vent cable car. On the side of the valley opposite Aiguille du Midi you can take a gondola lift from Chamonix to Plan Praz, then switch to the cable car that will take you across and up to Le Br√©vent, another incredible mountain peak at 8,284 feet (2,525 m). Up here you‚Äôll get views to rival even those of Aiguille du Midi, since this time you get see the Aiguille du Midi and Mont Blanc in all its terrifyingly immense glory.
sources.shortName: 22 Awesome Things to Do in Chamonix in the Summer: Alpine Bucket List

places.name: T√©l√©ph√©rique du Br√©vent

reviews.text: Beautiful views to see aiguille du midi from here. There are two cable cars, one to plan praz - to ski, then one more Brevent cable car up to the highest point. Check their app for opening as brevent cable car may not always be open due to weather.
A great ski resort with plenty of runs suitable for all abilities and good facilities. We came later in the season when other resorts are closing, but we still managed a days skiing here.
walked from here to telesiege de I'Index to then get a ski lift to a higher point on the mountain. the veiw along the walk did not disappoint for one second and there was lots of amazing wildlife

places.generalDescription: Promenade du Lac des Gaillands, located about two kilometers south of Chamonix near the Gaillands Lake, is a popular spot for both extreme mountain climbers and beginners. The area offers challenging climbing routes along the north faces as well as boulders suitable for amateur climbers. The small lake provides a picturesque setting with ducks and stunning views of the mountains. Visitors can also enjoy leisurely activities such as biking or walking around the area.

sources.snippet: Many extreme mountain climbers aspire to climb the granite rock face at Chamonix. There are extremely challenging mountain climbing routes along the north faces as well as boulders for amateur climbers and beginners. About two kilometers south of Chamonix next to the Gaillands Lake, the Rochers Gaillands offer a range of climbing routes from easy to difficult.
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions in Chamonix-Mont-Blanc | PlanetWare

places.name: Promenade du Lac des Gaillands

reviews.text: What an amazing small lake with ducks and a unbelievable view to the mountains. Went there on a bike ride and discover this by accident. Totally recommend even if you go on a walk. Nearby there's a rock climbing area also very interesting.
nice and quiet place to relax and rest.
Such a beautiful place to sit down and relax. The ducks might come near you out side of the lake üòä

places.address: Promenade du lac des Gaillands, 74400 Chamonix-Mont-Blanc, France

places.generalDescription: Mer de Glace, which translates to "Sea of Ice" in French, is a massive glacier located near Chamonix. It features an ice cave that allows visitors to see and touch ancient ice from within the glacier. The cave is a manmade attraction excavated for tourism each year. As you descend down the stairs to the cave entrance, signs posted along the way indicate the historical height of the glacier, providing insight into its shrinking size due to changing climate conditions.

sources.snippet: At 200m (656ft) deep and 7km (4mi) in length, the Mer de Glace is France‚Äôs largest glacier. This Sea of Ice is only a train ride away from the centre of Chamonix. Though the glacier itself is worth viewing for its beauty, the Mer de Glace allows visitors to bear witness to the undeniable impacts climate change has had on the Alps.
sources.shortName: The Top Things To See And Do In Chamonix, France

sources.snippet: Montez dans le c√©l√®bre petit train rouge √† cr√©maill√®re depuis la gare du Montenvers pour un voyage √† travers le temps et partez √† la d√©couverte de la mythique Mer de Glace. Arriv√©s √† la gare du Montenvers, √† 1 913 m√®tres, vous pourrez admirer la vue sur les montagnes et descendre dans les entrailles du glacier. Prenez la t√©l√©cabine depuis la gare du Montenvers pour acc√©der au glacier de la Mer de Glace et visiter la grotte de glace, taill√©e √† main d‚Äôhomme !
sources.shortName: √Ä la d√©couverte des plus beaux sites de la vall√©e de Chamonix

sources.snippet: Mer de Glace is one of the largest glaciers in Europe, spanning over seven kilometers in length. And this is why the French call it the ‚ÄúSea of Ice.‚Äù Once there, you might feel underwhelmed as it‚Äôs difficult to distinguish the glacier from the landscape. But look for signs of the ‚ÄúGrotte de Glace,‚Äù a 200-meter-long cave taking you into the glacier.
sources.shortName: Chamonix Is the French Alps at Their Finest ‚Äî Here‚Äôs How to Make the Most of It

sources.snippet: Since it was only early afternoon we decided to finish the day with a ride in the famous cogwheel railway towards the Mer de Glace. The "ocean of ice" nicely describes the long glacier winding down from the Mont Blanc. During its long descend it collects lots of dirt and stones from the sides of the glacier and therefore is not purely white.
sources.shortName: Mont Blanc near Chamonix

sources.snippet: The Mer de Glace is a valley glacier located on the northern slopes of the Mont Blanc massif, in the French Alps. It is 7.5 km long and 200 metres deep but, when all its tributary glaciers are taken into account, it can be regarded as the longest and largest glacier in France, and the second longest in the Alps after the Aletsch Glacier.
sources.shortName: Travel Guide of Chamonix by Influencers for 2023

sources.snippet: Discovered by tourists in the 19th century, the Mer de Glace is one of the largest glaciers in Europe. Its French name translates to "Sea of Ice," which makes sense considering the glacier spans seven kilometers in length. The Mer de Glace is accessible by taking the Montenvers railway, an old-fashioned red train.
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions in Chamonix-Mont-Blanc | PlanetWare

sources.snippet: Mer de Glace (Sea of Ice) is 7km long and 200m deep and is one of the biggest attractions in the Chamonix Valley. Easily accessible with a train from Chamonix. We will photograph there some of the most prestigious peaks in Chamonix: Les Drus (3754m), Les Grands Jorasses (4205m) and the Aiguille du Grepon (3482m).
sources.siteName: Photographer in Chamonix - Family and adventure photo sessions
sources.shortName: Adventure in Chamonix 2019 - 4 days - Photographer in Chamonix

places.name: Mer de Glace

reviews.text: The amount of glacier knowledge you will gain on this visit and the beauty you will see is what makes this worth it. Just don't think about all the stairs and enjoy the journey.

Beautiful and wonderful. Please protect our glaciers, it's so sad to see they are melting so fast. They are the resources that give us fresh water. And it's the nature that we have to protect in every aspect. Loved to be there and I am sure that you will enjoy too.

To the glacier viewpoint by train then by gondola to the glacier. Also suitable for smaller children. The glacier melts quickly and the experience in the glacier is special. üíúThe speed of the ice melting is shown in the video. Buy ticket on internet‚≠êÔ∏è

places.generalDescription: Grotte de glace is a stunning tourist attraction that can be reached via a trail or cable car. This man-made tunnel of ice has been sculpted every year for the past 50 years, displaying perennially recreated ice sculptures and history exhibits. The path to get there can be challenging due to an endless number of stairs, but it's worth it once you step inside the glittering ice cave.

sources.snippet: Snaking, cracking, shimmering a brilliant blue in places and covered by mystical frost in others, the Mer de Glace displays nature in all its powerful glory. France‚Äôs longest glacier stretches for 4.3 miles and is over 650 feet deep. Quite literally a sea of ice, it continues to move under its own weight; its surfaces break up, crevasses appear, and pointed columns of ice known as seracs burst from the surface.
sources.shortName: Best Things to Do in Chamonix

places.name: Grotte de Glace

reviews.text:
What a fun & unique experience!

To get to the ice cave we needed to catch a train, then a gondola ride then a small walk down some outdoor steps. The view was amazing once you got off the train!!

I'd say the whole round trip takes roughly 2 hours. The price seemed reasonable for all the entry and transport.

We didn't book prior to visiting, we just went at 11am and purchased the tickets there! I heard they open at 10am so might be best to do this first thing in the morning!

There are restaurants, bathrooms & cafe/bar once you get off the train! The view from the restaurant is also awesome!

An amazing, don't miss adventure. You star with a ride from the train station up the mountain on a cog railway. Then a cable car takes you to a landing where you walk down to the cave, carved fresh each year, out of the glacier. Walk through, enjoy the shimmering ice walls and ceiling.  Not just walking on a glacier but IN a glacier. Lots of little signs with glacier trivia inside, too.

Came on a Friday morning to avoid a big crowd. There's only one way down and one way in and out, and the walkway isn't very wide - so this is best enjoyed when it's not packed with people. It wasn't very cold inside in June, unless you intend to stay long then a light jacket would do. 10-15 mins was sufficient to walk through even with kids, or you can stay longer to cool off from the summer heat. Worth the experience if you are already coming up here, and also there's not much else to do if you're not hiking. Do note that the metal stairs down to the cave from the gondola station might not be suitable for people with accessibility difficulties or vertigo.

places.generalDescription: Les Grands Montets in Chamonix, France is a renowned destination offering world-class skiing and stunning mountain views. With slopes suitable for all skill levels, it attracts both beginners and experienced skiers. The area's cable cars provide access to a high mountain landscape with exceptional views of the Argentiere glacier, the Aiguilles Rouges, and Mont Blanc. Since its opening in 1963, Les Grands Montets has been a key factor in Chamonix's popularity.

sources.snippet: Soaring above the village of Argenti√®re, the cable cars of the Grands Montets area take you quickly into a wild, high mountain landscape. From the different vantage points, take in exceptional views of the Argenti√®re glacier, the Drus, the Aiguilles Rouges and Mont Blanc itself. One of the most accessible glacier viewpoints ‚Äì where you can really test your skills for photography in Chamonix ‚Äì is a 45 minute walk from the Lognan mid-station.
sources.shortName: Unmissable viewpoints for photography in Chamonix

sources.snippet:
The Grands Montets is the highest and most challenging area,
 found between 1235-3300 metres and covering the Argentiere
 glacier and the slopes of Lognan and the Pendant. The area is accessed by cablecar or chairlift from Argentiere,
 though many complain of the queues. There are 28
 kilometres of pistes in all, including 6 black runs - such as the
 famous and very steep Point de Vue and
 Pylones routes - and 4 red runs.
sources.shortName: 10 best things to do in Chamonix

sources.snippet: If you plan to visit in the winter, skiing is probably on your agenda. Les Grands Montets is the largest and most popular ski resort in the Chamonix region. With over 2,000 meters of skiing runs and exceptional snow, it is one of the most impressive in the world.
sources.shortName: Chamonix Is the French Alps at Their Finest ‚Äî Here‚Äôs How to Make the Most of It

places.name: Les Grands Montets

reviews.text: Great place to ski. Some good challenging runs and amazing views. It is in the shade most of the day so choose a warm day and by late morning you can find places in the sun.

Open bowl skiing above tree line with steep reds.  The views of the other Chamonix ski resorts and valley from the top was breathtaking.  The skiback to the base was long and steep, great to finish your legs off at the end of a long day.  Enjoy!

It's fairly large, but the tram is down for a while which focuses people onto the other runs. Some hike it.   The snow was packed and icy and the slopes were uber crowded. Great views, though.

The restaurants and such are nice with lots of food options and friendly staff.  I felt the ribs were a little tough, but had good flavor.  The vegetables were perfectly done.

places.address: 66 Chem. de la Glaci√®re, 74400 Chamonix-Mont-Blanc, France

places.generalDescription: Lacs des Ch√©serys is a stunning alpine destination located in the Aiguilles Rouges massif, offering a unique experience for nature enthusiasts. The journey to the lakes begins with a choice of two routes from an open forest, catering to both experienced climbers and those seeking an easier path. Accessible via the La Fl√©g√®re cable car from Chamonix valley, this picturesque hike provides breathtaking views of Mont Blanc and surrounding peaks.

sources.snippet: the lac de cheserys lake near brevent cable station, with a view of mont blanc mountain ‚Äì a classic landscape photography spot, photo: ludovic f. chamonix is ‚Äòthe‚Äô mountaineering location in the alps. only the himalayas rise as high and as steep.
sources.shortName: The Best 300 Photo Spots In The Alps And Europe Mountain Moments

sources.snippet: Lying there between Lac Blanc ‚Äì the White Lake ‚Äì and the smaller Lacs de Ch√©serys is undisputedly the most beautiful view of the entire Mont Blanc massif.
sources.shortName: Chamonix Hikers‚Äô Vivid Viewpoint Lac Blanc / Lacs de Ch√©serys! South Balcony‚Äôs Grand Panorama of Chamonix Valley

places.name: Lacs des Ch√©serys

reviews.text: Great place with an amazing panorama, with quite some space for tents but very crowded in the summer. Everyone seems to respect the rules so no random idiots here. Will come back in off season for sure.
Worth the hike up, amazing view of the lake and Mont Blanc.
One of the most beautiful spots in the alps! Excellent for night photography. If you take up two Gondels you can save yourself a long hike. Hike from the last cable car is around 1 hour 45 minutes.

places.generalDescription: Bossons Glacier, situated in the Mont Blanc massif in Chamonix, France, is a remarkable natural wonder known for its imposing icefall and impressive crevasses. Visitors can access this enormous mountain glacier via hiking trails or a chair lift that takes them to a chalet with a restaurant at an elevation of 1,425m. The glacier offers breathtaking views and hikers can take a 2.

sources.snippet: There‚Äôs no right or wrong way to reach the Glacier des Bossons. A short, though mildly difficult, hike through wildflowers will lead you straight there. An even shorter chair lift will climb the 1.4km (0.9mi) glacier for you, dropping you off at the chateau resting above Bossons village.
sources.shortName: The Top Things To See And Do In Chamonix, France

sources.snippet: Leaving from Les Bossons, this rickety old chairlift will transport you back in time, and up to heights of 1,425m. From the top of the chair, it‚Äôs just a short walk to the chalet for refreshments and initial views of the Bossons glacier, or wander further along the path to get up close and personal, and to admire the seracs on the Plateau des Pyramides. Alternatively, walk up from the town centre, passing the plunging Cascade du Dard and their tempting snack hut to the viewpoint on the other side of the glacier.
sources.shortName: Unmissable viewpoints for photography in Chamonix

sources.snippet: To experience a completely unique nature site, visit the Glacier des Bossons during summer. Hikers can take the 2.6-kilometer walking trail from Chamonix that leads to the Chalet du Glacier des Bossons (at 1,425 meters), which takes about 90 minutes each way. From the village of Les Bossons, take the chairlift, which glides above lush green Alpine meadows to arrive near the Chalet du Glacier des Bossons.
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions in Chamonix-Mont-Blanc | PlanetWare

places.name: Bossons Glacier

reviews.text: Hiked from the bus stop around 8.5km, 4 hours, 1,600 m. ascent, we will see the fantastic view.

Took the ski lift at bossons and ended up at the cute refuge, and the start of the TMB la jonction path! Don't attempt this path on a foggy day or if you're not prepared!!! When I got up to the start, it was too foggy to undergo the hike, but there was a quick 10min path to the left behind the refuge where you get to learn a little bit about history, see a photo time lapse board showing the glacier retreat and gets you to a view point for the glacier itself. Definitely worth it to come by and check it out!

Go for it, as long as it's there. Amazing.
For example: use Chairlift, then 1.5h walk towards glacier = amazing view and relatively close. Even with Children no Problem, easy walk and worth it

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the French Alps, Chamonix is a renowned mountain paradise that attracts visitors from around the globe. The region boasts towering peaks, including the majestic Mont Blanc, and offers numerous ski resorts and charming towns. Accessible via a scenic one-hour drive from Geneva airport, Chamonix provides breathtaking views and an array of outdoor activities such as skiing and camping. Despite its popularity, the area remains relatively unspoiled by large crowds.

sources.snippet: Join us for a swiss & french alps photo tour to capture some of the most breathtaking landscapes in the highest mountains in europe. from massive peaks, impressive glaciers, and epic valleys to photogenic waterfalls, turquoise lakes, and beautiful alpine villages, this region of the alps is one of the best natural wonders in europe. From the snow capped peaks of the swiss alps to the verdant valleys of the austrian tyrol, these 13 villages are bursting with charm and natural beauty.
sources.shortName: The Best 300 Photo Spots In The Alps And Europe Mountain Moments

places.name: French Alps

reviews.text: The road trip was cool , all green during summer and many stops for nice photos easy and picnic areas are around, I loved all villages around
The best place I've ever been
One of the most beautiful sceneries in France. Definitely worth the drive.  I hope to visit again someday
